question: Will Amazon still list a 12-pack of Coca-Cola as "SNAP EBT eligible" on April 1, 2025?
reasoning:
Based on the extracted evidence, here are the key points relevant to the question:

1. **Amazon's Commitment to SNAP EBT**: Amazon has been actively participating in the USDA's SNAP Online Purchasing Pilot since 2016 and has expanded SNAP EBT acceptance to nearly every state in the U.S. They have waived the Prime membership requirement for SNAP customers, indicating a strong commitment to supporting SNAP beneficiaries.

2. **SNAP EBT Eligibility Label**: SNAP-eligible food items on Amazon are clearly labeled as "SNAP EBT eligible" once a SNAP participant adds their EBT card to their Amazon account. This labeling is crucial for identifying eligible products.

3. **No Recent Policy Changes Detected**: There are no indications of recent policy changes that would affect the SNAP EBT eligibility of Coca-Cola or similar products on Amazon. The focus has been on expanding access and increasing benefits rather than restricting eligibility.

4. **Stability in SNAP Benefits**: The USDA has increased maximum allotments for SNAP benefits for the fiscal year 2025, which could enhance purchasing power but does not directly impact eligibility criteria for specific products like Coca-Cola.

Given Amazon's ongoing commitment to supporting SNAP beneficiaries and the absence of any recent policy changes that would affect the eligibility of Coca-Cola, it is likely that the product will remain listed as "SNAP EBT eligible" on April 1, 2025.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.9

search_results.content: SNAP benefits are placed on an Electronic Benefits Transfer (EBT) card and can be used to purchase food at local and participating online retailers. Maximum monthly allotment levels are set by the Federal government and are subject to change each October 1.

extracted_facts.fact: The USDA gradually increases the age of 'able-bodied adults without dependents' (ABAWD) subject to work requirements, which could affect the number of people eligible for SNAP benefits.

facts.fact: Amazon volunteered to participate in the USDA’s SNAP Online Purchasing Pilot in 2016, indicating a long-term commitment to the program.

facts.title: https://www.aboutamazon.com/news/retail/nearly-every-snap-household-in-the-u-s-can-pay-with-snap-ebt-on-amazon
facts.fact: Amazon has waived the Prime membership requirement for SNAP customers to access Amazon Fresh, reducing barriers to online grocery shopping.

facts.title: https://www.aboutamazon.com/news/retail/nearly-every-snap-household-in-the-u-s-can-pay-with-snap-ebt-on-amazon
facts.fact: Amazon provides more than 99% of SNAP households with the ability to use their SNAP benefits online.

facts.title: https://www.aboutamazon.com/news/retail/nearly-every-snap-household-in-the-u-s-can-pay-with-snap-ebt-on-amazon
facts.fact: Amazon is committed to making food accessible through online grocery shopping, offering convenience, time savings, and low prices.

tool_outputs.name: btf_extract_evidence

facts.title: https://seniornavigator.org/article/74670/frequently-asked-questions-about-snap-online-shopping
facts.fact: SNAP-eligible food items on Amazon have a special label 'SNAP EBT eligible' that appears after a SNAP participant adds their SNAP EBT card to their Amazon account.

facts.title: https://seniornavigator.org/article/74670/frequently-asked-questions-about-snap-online-shopping
facts.fact: Only items shipped and sold by Amazon.com, including Amazon Pantry and Amazon Fresh, are eligible for purchasing with SNAP benefits.

facts.title: https://seniornavigator.org/article/74670/frequently-asked-questions-about-snap-online-shopping
facts.fact: USDA requires all SNAP authorized retailers, including authorized online retailers like Amazon, to ensure SNAP benefits are used to purchase eligible food items.

facts.title: https://seniornavigator.org/article/74670/frequently-asked-questions-about-snap-online-shopping
facts.fact: Amazon allows third parties to sell items in the Amazon store, but only the offers that are 'Shipped and Sold by Amazon' are eligible for purchase with SNAP EBT.

facts.title: https://seniornavigator.org/article/74670/frequently-asked-questions-about-snap-online-shopping
facts.fact: Amazon is participating in a government pilot program to accept SNAP EBT benefits online, and government requirements determine which zip codes are eligible for delivery.

messages.content:
Based on the following question, analyze it carefully and provide your probability estimate.

Question: Will Amazon still list a 12-pack of Coca-Cola as "SNAP EBT eligible" on April 1, 2025?
Background: 
Resolution criteria: This question resolves as **Yes** if a 12-page of Coca-Cola at [this link](https://www.amazon.com/Coca-Cola-Soda-Soft-Drink-Pack/dp/B000T9WLTK?ref_=ast_sto_dp&th=1), when accessed by Metaculus from the United States on or after April 1, 2025, is listed using the exact phrase "SNAP EBT eligible"(forecasters please note that it *is* listed as such on February 19, 2025). If it is *not* listed as SNAP EBT eligible when checked by Metataculus on or after April 1, 2025, this resolves as **No**.
Fine print: The link in the resolution criteria is provided for convenience, but if Amazon's primary listing for a 12-pack of canned Coca-Cola appears elsewhere, then that will be used for resolution. In order to streamline resolution, synonyms or rephrasings will not count; the phrase must specifically be "SNAP EBT eligible".
present_date: 2025-03-24T22:25:27.466570


Make sure to use the tools at your disposal to gather relevant information before providing your final probability estimate.

You may reason through the problem, but you MUST end your response with:
FINAL PROBABILITY: [your decimal number between 0 and 1]

If it is *not* listed as SNAP EBT eligible when checked by Metataculus on or after April 1, 2025, this resolves as **No**.","fine_print":"The link in the resolution criteria is provided for convenience, but if Amazon's primary listing for a 12-pack of canned Coca-Cola appears elsewhere, then that will be used for resolution. In order to streamline resolution, synonyms or rephrasings will not count; the phrase must specifically be \"SNAP EBT eligible\".","present_date":"2025-03-24T22:25:27.466570","date_cutoff_start":null,"date_cutoff_end":null,"scoring_weight":1.0,"resolution":"unknown","resolved_at":null,"max_queries":5}

Chart information is based upon SNAP Standards effective October 1, 2024.", "date": null}, {"title": "Food Stamps: 4 Major Changes to SNAP in 2025", "link": "https://www.yahoo.com/news/food-stamps-4-major-changes-120021102.html", "position": 5, "snippet": "The USDA adjusts SNAP maximum allotments, deductions and income eligibility standards at the beginning of each federal fiscal year. For fiscal year 2025, the FNS increased maximum allotments and shelter caps for most U.S. states and territories.", "date": null}]}

messages.content: {"question_id": "0acc6f1d-f256-519b-b1da-0076b39fc6e6", "url": "https://www.yahoo.com/news/food-stamps-4-major-changes-120021102.html", "facts": [{"title": "https://www.yahoo.com/news/food-stamps-4-major-changes-120021102.html", "url": "https://www.yahoo.com/news/food-stamps-4-major-changes-120021102.html", "fact": "The USDA adjusts SNAP maximum allotments, deductions, and income eligibility standards at the beginning of each federal fiscal year, with the fiscal year for 2025 beginning on October 1, 2024."}, {"title": "https://www.yahoo.com/news/food-stamps-4-major-changes-120021102.html", "url": "https://www.yahoo.com/news/food-stamps-4-major-changes-120021102.html", "fact": "For fiscal year 2025, the FNS increased maximum allotments and shelter caps for most U.S. states and territories, which could affect the purchasing power of SNAP benefits."}, {"title": "https://www.yahoo.com/news/food-stamps-4-major-changes-120021102.html", "url": "https://www.yahoo.com/news/food-stamps-4-major-changes-120021102.html", "fact": "The maximum allotment for a family of four in the 48 states and D.C. will be $975, indicating an increase in benefits that could influence the range of products eligible for SNAP EBT."}, {"title": "https://www.yahoo.com/news/food-stamps-4-major-changes-120021102.html", "url": "https://www.yahoo.com/news/food-stamps-4-major-changes-120021102.html", "fact": "The minimum benefit for the 48 states and D.C. will remain the same at $23, suggesting stability in the baseline SNAP benefits."}, {"title": "https://www.yahoo.com/news/food-stamps-4-major-changes-120021102.html", "url": "https://www.yahoo.com/news/food-stamps-4-major-changes-120021102.html", "fact": "The USDA gradually increases the age of 'able-bodied adults without dependents' (ABAWD) subject to work requirements, which could affect the number of people eligible for SNAP benefits."}]}

'Shipped and Sold by Amazon' are eligible for purchase with SNAP EBT."}, {"title": "https://seniornavigator.org/article/74670/frequently-asked-questions-about-snap-online-shopping", "url": "https://seniornavigator.org/article/74670/frequently-asked-questions-about-snap-online-shopping", "fact": "Amazon is participating in a government pilot program to accept SNAP EBT benefits online, and government requirements determine which zip codes are eligible for delivery."}]}
messages.name: btf_extract_evidence

messages.content:
Based on the extracted evidence, here are the key points relevant to the question:

1. **Amazon's Commitment to SNAP EBT**: Amazon has been actively participating in the USDA's SNAP Online Purchasing Pilot since 2016 and has expanded SNAP EBT acceptance to nearly every state in the U.S. They have waived the Prime membership requirement for SNAP customers, indicating a strong commitment to supporting SNAP beneficiaries.

2. **SNAP EBT Eligibility Label**: SNAP-eligible food items on Amazon are clearly labeled as "SNAP EBT eligible" once a SNAP participant adds their EBT card to their Amazon account. This labeling is crucial for identifying eligible products.

3. **No Recent Policy Changes Detected**: There are no indications of recent policy changes that would affect the SNAP EBT eligibility of Coca-Cola or similar products on Amazon. The focus has been on expanding access and increasing benefits rather than restricting eligibility.

4. **Stability in SNAP Benefits**: The USDA has increased maximum allotments for SNAP benefits for the fiscal year 2025, which could enhance purchasing power but does not directly impact eligibility criteria for specific products like Coca-Cola.

Given Amazon's ongoing commitment to supporting SNAP beneficiaries and the absence of any recent policy changes that would affect the eligibility of Coca-Cola, it is likely that the product will remain listed as "SNAP EBT eligible" on April 1, 2025.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.9
